page.title: 09CUSTOMS
page.content: AT CHRISTMAS-TIME A CAROL SERVICE AND MIDNIGHT MASS ARE HELD BY CANDLELIGHT IN THE CHURCH.THE HARVEST SERVICE IS ALWAYS WELL ATTENDED AND THE CHURCH IS BEAUTIFULLY DECORATED WITH FRUIT, FLOWERS AND VEGETABLES.AFTER THE SERVICE,THE GIFTS ARE AUCTIONED AT THE MANOR INN FOR CHURCH FUNDS.EVERY 25 YEARS A CANDLE AUCTION IS HELD IN THE SAME INN,IN THE PRESENCE OF THE BISHOP OF BATH AND WELLS.THE CHURCH ACRE OF LAND IN CHEDZOY LANE,LEFT TO THE VILLAGE IN THE MIDDLE AGES BY A MEMBER OF THE SYDENHAM FAMILY TO BE AUCTIONED IN PERPETUITY,GOES TO THE LAST BIDDER BEFORE THE CANDLE GOES OUT.ALSO IN THE CHURCHYARD ARE TWO VERY UNUSUAL CLAPPER STILES. SKITTLES,A TRADITIONAL SOMERSET GAME IS PLAYED IN THE MANOR INN.THE SCHOOL CHILDREN PERFORM MAYPOLE DANCES.A FLOWER AND DOG SHOW IS HELD ANNUALLY.
